EventCounterVersatile1

This component is used to count events and present the count at the data output [Out]cnt. This is a more versatile version of the basic counter and can be incremented when the input event [In]inc fires or decremented when the input event [In]dec fires. A maximum and minimum threshold can be set by specifying the parameters Max. Threshold and Min. Threshold or by overriding the parameters by presenting values to the data inputs [In]max and [In]min respectively. Note that if a value of 0 is used for the Max. Threshold parameter then the Max. Threshold is set to 2147483647, which is the maximum permissible value. The count is reset when the event input [In]rst fires and stops without resetting when the event input [In]stop fires.

If the count exceeds the upper threshold then the overflow output event [Out]ovf is triggered, similarly if the count exceeds the lower threshold then the overflow output event [Out]ovf is triggered. If and only if the count does not exceed the thresholds when an increment or decrement event fires, then the corresponding output event will be triggered and the count value will be presented to the data output [Out]cnt.

The value if the counter is 0 at initialisation and is reset to 0 when the input event [In]rst is triggered. The exception to this is when the minimum threshold is greater than 0 in which case the counter is initialised to the minimum threshold. Similarly if the maximum threshold is less than 0 then the counter is initialised to the maximum threshold.

If the values presented to either of the data inputs [In]max or [In]min change then the new thresholds will be used on the next increment, decrement or reset events. If the value of the counter is greater than the new maximum threshold then the counter will be set to the maximum threshold and similarly if the the counter is less than the new minimum threshold then the counter will be set to the minimum threshold. Note that the counter value is changed to be within the new thresholds before the increment or decrement of its value. For example when the input event [In]inc fires, if the counter value is below the new minimum threshold it will be set to the new minimum threshold and before its value is incremented and presented to the data output [Out]cnt.

Ports

  • [In] start:

    Input event, enables the counter to start counting events.

  • [In] inc:

    Input event, triggers an increment of the counter and presents the count to the data output [Out]cnt.

  • [In] dec:

    Input event, triggers an decrement of the counter and presents the count to the data output [Out]cnt.

  • [In] rst:

    Input event, resets the count to zero, or to the minimum threshold if it is greater than 0, or to the maximum threshold if it is less than zero.

  • [In] stop:

    Input event, stops the counter from counting events.

  • [In] max:

    Data input, the maximum threshold for the counter. Overrides the parameter Max. Threshold.

  • [In] min:

    Data input, the minimum threshold for the counter. Overrides the parameter Min. Threshold.

  • [Out] cnt:

    Data output, the current count.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, fires if and only if an increment event is received and the count is less than the maximum threshold.

  • [Out] :

    Output event, fires if and only if a decrement event is received and the count is greater than the minimum threshold.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

  • [Out] :

    Output event.

  • [Out] ovf:

    Output event, fires if and only if an increment event is received and the count is equal to or greater than the maximum threshold.

  • [Out] ovf:

    Output event, fires if and only if a decrement event is received and the count is equal to or less than the minimum threshold.

Parameters

  • Max. Threshold:

    Threshold value for ovf event.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    -2147483648,

    Max Value:

    2147483647,

    Default Value:

    1000

  • Min. Threshold:

    Threshold value for ovf event.

    Data Type:

    I,

    Min Value:

    -2147483648,

    Max Value:

    2147483647,

    Default Value:

    0

State Machine

Stateless.

Profiles

All.

Toolbox

Core.

Version

v2.1.

Native Dependencies

  • TDK1.1:

Licence Type

LGPL.

Component Supplier

inx ltd.
